headline: Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai
description: Replace rice noodles with shredded spaghetti squash in this lower carb recipe for pad thai.
name: Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai
recipeIngredient: 1 small spaghetti squash, halved and seeded

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Place spaghetti squash, cut-side up, on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender, 30 to 45 minutes. Shred squash meat using a fork and discard the peel.

Combine chicken broth, peanut butter, chile-garlic sauce, fish sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, oyster sauce, ginger, sesame oil, and black pepper together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Whisk water and cornstarch together in a bowl until smooth; add to broth mixture and continue boiling until sauce thickens, 5 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer sauce.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; saute broccoli slaw, zucchini, red bell pepper, green onion, cilantro, and shredded spaghetti squash until tender, about 10 minutes. Add chicken and sauce to squash mixture; cook and stir until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Loved this recipe. I added a bit of sriracha because I like spicy food but it was great even before that addition.

One of our favorite dishes! We add extra protein and veges (matchstick carrots, peppers, onions, garlic, zucchini) which means extra sauce, too. I agree with recommendation on preparing spaghetti squash separately. Roasted peanuts are a good addition for a little crunch. My retired husband likes the leftovers for his lunch. I also add a bit of lime and sometimes add curry paste.

This dish had just the right amount of heat for us. I used sesame oil instead of olive oil for the vegetables because I wanted to finish off a bottle. To finish it, I sprinkled some chopped peanuts on top for more texture, but otherwise made as directed. You don't really need the chicken, so I'll skip it next time. I will also probably try the squeeze of lime, others have suggested, to brighten it up but it is delicious as written.
It didn’t turn out exactly how I had hoped because I didn’t have the vegetables prepared beforehand, but my family ate all but one small serving so I was happy. I will be prepared and try again.
Great recipe Loved the sauce. I have made this twice already. Once added rotisserie chicken excellent and reheats well.
Good but nothing like Pad Thai. Thanks to the reviewer who recommended not stirring the squash into the sauce.

My family and I loved this! I made a few changes out of necessity ( used teriyaki sauce instead of soy and no cilantro) added red pepper flakes because I cook Thai and know our spicy level, and For next time I would for personal preference reduce chicken broth a few ounces, and stir fry the vegetables a little less time. So good!

This is hands down one of our favorite recipes. However, I would say the prep time is more like 45 minutes (def if you have kids AKA hinder helpers). But seriously, this is such a tasty and healthy meal...everyone is happy!

This recipe is really good. I think it could be very forgiving in regards to the veggies used. Can be spiced up if desired. My main take away is that it was a great option for spaghetti squash! I cooked the squash ahead of time. Warmed it up in the microwave. I placed the squash on the plate and topped with the veggies/meat mixture. No leftovers!

Made it just as written and loved it! My only suggestion would be to add more veggies or cut back a little on the sauce. A quick (if you've already got the squash cooked) and easy weeknight recipe. Will definitely make this again.

I made several omissions/substitutions just based on what I had in my pantry. I did not have fish or oyster sauce. I am sure that leaving them out changed the flavor profile a lot, but on the plus side it made it vegan (for those who need that), and still delicious. Instead I added an additional tablespoon of soy sauce. I used vegetable broth instead of chicken broth and omitted the chicken, because I am vegetarian. 

I also did not have chili garlic sauce but I know from experience that siracha + garlic powder will work. You need less siracha though because it is spicier.

I made noodles on the side for those who prefer that (I have kids), and left the spaghetti squash seperate from the sauce and veggies. I sliced broccoli into matchsticks for the vegggie, along with a diced onion. I had a huge broccoli head so I decided not to add any additional veggies.

The sauce with the just barely crunchy squash noodles was a satisfying combo. I would suggest adding tofu or something of you omit the chicken because I realized once I was eating that it really could use more proten.

My favorite recipies are versatile and can take a good amount of tweaking. This one seems to fit the bill. Despite my changing it a good deal it was delicious.
Excellent recipe, loved it!!
Yummy! Didn't have the fish sauce and changed the protein for vegetarian version but it was still delicious
It didn’t taste like Pad Thai to me, but the sauce was really good. Followed the recipe to the T, grilled the chicken and added a squeeze of fresh lime juice which brightened it up! Super easy.
My family loved it
Loved this. My husband was impressed and said it was the best thing I'd ever made. Substituted shrimps for chicken and served in the squash shell.

Excellent recipe! 
Substitutions because I don't have all the ingredients:
- 1T garlic-chile sauce - subbed 1T red curry paste and 1t minced garlic
- 1T oyster sauce - subbed 1T sriracha sauce
- 1T Fish sauce- subbed 1T Hoisin sauce
Added: 1T extra peanut butter and 1T Brown Sugar to make extra yummy.
I will definitely make this again. It was a great low carb dish. My family is so sick of chicken all the time so this was a great way to give them something different. The whole family loved it!
This was great! I used baked tofu
One of my family’s favorite dishes!
Very very good! Beautiful flavors. Didn't even miss the noodles!!
I added a jalapeño for a little zing
Delicious

Made one ‘recipe’ of this, and overall, enjoyed it. I agree with a previous reviewer that keeping the squash separate until the end is good, but tossing the squash into the rest of it is important to make it more pad-Thai-ish. This was my first attempt, so I split the sauce and chicken, half over squash, half over pho noodles (for my kids). They loved it! Next time I’ll probably up the chili sauce for more spice. It’s a solid recipe, as is.

Perfect. I added some rutabaga because I had it and tamarind concentrate for the same reason. Served w/peanuts on top. I find cooking squash whole in the microwave easier and faster than using the oven.

We really enjoyed this easy recipe that could be vegetarian or great with tofu. I used mushrooms since I did not have zucchini and I did increase the chili garlic sauce since we like spice. I used the spaghetti squash as a bed for the vegetables and sauce, glad I did not mix the squash into the dish. Peanuts and lime juice on top are a must! I will put the cilantro as a garnish on top next time rather than cooking it. We will definitely make again!
Hands down best dish I’ve made all year! I added celery and cashews. Delicious!

Great recipe! Loved it! Didn't have fish sauce, so I added a little Housin sauce just because I had it. Similar to other comments, I didn't add the spaghetti squash noodles to the veggies...just put them on plate and topped with the vegetable mix. I think it would be just as good without the chicken, if you don't have any. Even my picky grandson enjoyed it!
loved this
Excellent recipe. Everyone loved it. Easy to get out of hand on the peppers and spicy flavor.

Amazing recipe!!! Pad Thai is one of my favorite dishes. Having a healthier version is awesome. I made it exactly as the recipe stated except I added egg. Egg did not change the flavor, just another a kind of protein. Delicious!!!

Delicious way to use spagetti squash. I thickened sauce with Bob's red mill egg replacement (for one egg) and was perfect. I used red peppers, purple cabbage, broccoli cut up and kale (I put kale in everything!) Definitely a keeper reciepe!!!
5 star recipe....we loved it! I used prawns and had to cut down on some of the veggies as I didn’t have enough room in the skillet. Will definitely make this again!
Very good. I used crunchy peanut butter which was great.

AMAZING! I used coconut oil- no evoo. I added 3T lime juice, 1/2 can coconut milk to sauce ingredients. I added diced Portobello to vegetable imgredients. Topped with chopped peanuts and parsley. HEAVENLY. 

DONT EVER USE FOIL-CONTRIBUTES TO BRAIN DISEASE, use pot lid. :)
Highly recommend- amazing flavor!!
I have a peanut allergy so i substituted almond butter for the peanut butter. My friends who have eaten Pad Thai said it was excellent. I will make this again.

Wonderful! I modified the sauce slightly. As I didn't have chili garlic sauce or oyster sauce, I just skipped them. I added about 3 TBS of brown sugar and 3 TBS of chopped peanuts (dry roasted) to the sauce. Even my finicky 9 yr old loved it!
I had trouble shredding the squash, but other than that, it was delicious. Very flavorful with just the right amount of heat and peanut butter. Will definitely make this regularly!
I had trouble shredding the squash, but other than that, it was delicious. Very flavorful with just the right amount of heat and peanut butter. Will definitely make this regularly!
Issa NO.
The vegetable mixture is good, but the sauce is way to salty
Flavor profile was good but sauce too thick for my tastes

Delicious!! I substituted rice noodles for the spaghetti squash, and with a 16 oz package of noodles there was just quite not enough sauce. I would do 1.5 times the sauce ingredients next time. Delicious and easy to make!

Delish and healthy. I used the veggies I had on hand As suggested I did not mix the squash with the veggies and sauce but rather served on top. Will definitely use the leftover sauce for maybe a cold peanut noodle salad!

I made following instructions/ingredients. Overall, I think the flavor was great. The only change I would make next time is to not add the squash until the very end. I added it when stated, but by the time I was done everything was more of a paste than pasta. So less stirring after the squash is added would have given me the pasta-like presentation I was aiming for.
Replaced chicken with sausage
Made it true to the recipe and it was GREAT!
This recipe was super straight forward and delicious! For us, this yielded 4 servings - I would consider doubling the recipe to have left overs. We will definitely make this again!
Great recipe, a nice change on pad Thai!
Excellent as is.
This is good. It is even better when topped with peanuts.
This is good. It is even better when topped with peanuts.

Great recipe! Lots of liquid ingredients in small amounts but luckily I had most of it. I didn't use the broccoli coleslaw I substituted radicchio and bok choy and used sweet onion instead of green. The store only had siracha chili sauce. I put the sauce on as I served it as another reviewer suggested. Easily can substitute other vegetables . Thanks for the recipe!

This is excellent! I had a 4 lb squash, which I wouldn't call small and there was plenty of sauce. I did add some sugar as I thought that it needed to be a little sweeter. Didn't have broccoli slaw, so used some matchstick carrots. Also used Xanthan gum instead of corn starch to lower the carbs a bit.

I was pleasantly surprised at how much it tasted like pad Thai. My fiance, who doesn't like spaghetti squash, enjoyed this dish as well. It's so filling! But I had WAY more than 4 servings at the end.

I prepared the recipe as written. Although it was very good, there was still something lacking. I believe that maybe adding coconut milk to the sauce would give it a richer flavor and a more Thai flavor. And as others suggested, slices of lime with crushed peanuts on top would make this perfect. . I would definitely make this recipe again with those changes
I made the sauce as per recipe and just used a different mix of veggies. This was pretty darned good. I wish I had found this recipe earlier in my life...! Will certainly make again.
Absolutely awesome....tasted great!!!
Delicious, easy, healthy, and easy to change up. This is a new go to meal in my cookbook!
This is a keeper, did not find oyster sauce and did not buy cilantro. But, we will make this again!
loved this made sauce exactly as written, I did swap the zucchini for snow peas because that's what I had. Will make this many more times
Loved it and so did my hubby! Only thing I did different was to add crushed peanuts on top! Easy and delicious - will definitely be making this again!,
Delicious but doesn’t really taste like Pad Thai
This was really delicious! The spaghetti squash was a different texture, but the flavors really melded well together!
I made this recipe as written and it is excellent!!

I pretty much followed as written, although I started with raw chicken and sautéed it. I found the dish too spicy, and it didn't taste at all like Pad Thai to me. However, it was tasty in its own right. I will try again to make spaghetti squash Pad Thai, but will make it more like the traditional version while substituting spaghetti squash for the noodles.

I could drink the sauce, it was so delicious! I fried up some tofu and held back the spaghetti squash until the end as another reviewer recommended. Added a splash of lime juice. Next time I'd like to try some sprouts for extra crunch and maybe an egg, but man oh man was it good. I made this just for myself, can't wait to make it for company.

I'm not sure if we used too small of a spaghetti squash, the final result was sauce heavy, but overall a great recipe. We added a little bit of honey in order to sweeten the sauce just slightly, probably about a tablespoon.

I think the squash works pretty well as a substitute for rice noodles. The sauce is OK but needs some tweaking. I did add a touch of molasses sensing a lack of sweetness (tamarind traditionally) and extra lime wedges. Subbed shrimp for chicken and added scrambled egg and chopped peanuts as well!

This recipe is delicious...the flavors go well together. But, like other reviewer's have said, do not mix in the spaghetti squash noodles. I did that and,even though I tossed it very gently, it got mushy. Lay your noodles down first. Then put the sauce and veggie mixture over. It will look much prettier. 
I does taste amazing and I'll be making it again.
This was so good and even better with some lime squeezed over the top. I usually don't like Pad Thai well enough to have as an entrée, but this was great.
This was so delicious. I will definitely make it again.

A great base for someone new to making Pad Thai, and SUPER adaptable! I didn't measure any of my sauce ingredients and it still turned out awesome. I added a bit of honey to the sauce because we like it that way, and I used the veggies I had on hand for the stir fry (shredded cabbage, carrots, onions, bell peppers). I used tofu instead of chicken. I microwaved my spaghetti squash and served it under the pad thai instead of adding it to the veggies. See what I mean by adaptable?! I love it. Thank you so much!

Pad thai is my favorite meal, and I have never tried spaghetti squash before, so i was sceptical. However, this was so so so good. I followed the recipe exactly with a few additions. To the sauce i also added a bunch of pb2, as it increased the peanut flavor, added an extra spoon of garlic chilli sauce, as i like things spicy, and added a few tbs of brown sugar. I also used precut strir fry mix and chicken. In the end there was a ton of food and actually a ton of sauce. I could have used 1/2 the sauce, but it was really good, so i used it all. Yum yum yum.....thank you!!!!!

Really enjoyed the sauce - so flavourful. Prefer a lighter peanut butter flavour so added 1 tbsp. pbutter and 2 tbsp. chili sauce. Used Zucchini, Onions and matchstick carrots for the vegetables. Recommend putting the veg and sauce on the plated spaghetti squash.

I tried this recipe on leftover spaghetti squash, and it was very good, especially the sauce. I scaled it down, because I just used half of a half-squash. It was a small amount, and I followed the top reviewer's suggestion of just topping the squash with the sauce and veggies. Easy, and it all basically mixed in. I sauteed shredded green cabbage (also leftover!) and added a handful of frozen tri-color peppers just until they still had crispness to them. I didn't add the chicken or zucchini, but this dish could work with so many things (other veggies, shrimp, etc). I would make this again. Thanks!
Very good, had lots of flavor!

Really new way to use spaghetti squash which I always have in abundance once fall rolls around. I served this with some korean bbq'd chicken thighs and we really enjoyed the combination. I did up the peanut flavor and spice level to suit our tastes.
This was amazing ! Make it you will be happy. I adjusted it to fit my pantry items and added less sauce . Had fun with this one.

Made sauce as written. Perfect, would not change a thing. Took others advice and served sauce over squash, not mixed. Skipped the chicken adding more veggies. Excellent. 

Add peanuts before serving. Consider doubling the delicious sauce.
Loved it! Added cooked tofu; substituted the slaw with fresh broccoli and mung bean sprouts.

This was really good. I made pretty much as recipe stated. I stirred ch. peanuts into sauce, and cilantro into vegetables. Then I stirred sauce into vegetables and topped sp. squash w/the veg. sauce. I squeezed lime juice over top. I used ketchup for chili/garlic sauce left out oyster sauce and used EVOO instead of sesame oil. 2nd time I only added 1/2 of the broccoli slaw, 1/2 the pepper and 1/2 the zucchini. It seemed like there was too much sauce for the ingredients. So either cut down the spaghetti squash or add closer to the original amts. of vegetables. I also thought it could have used a little more peanut butter, I didn't get too much of the peanut butter taste.

My family loves this recipe. The only changes I made is to add Thai peppers to the peanut sauce while it is simmering and to increase the peanut butter 1 T to make the peanut flavor slightly stronger. Also, the easiest way to cook a spaghetti squash is to poke it with a metal skewer and then bake at 400 for 1 hr- 1 hr 15 min in a lined pan. So much easier than trying to cut an uncooked spaghetti squash.
This dish is amazing! I'm not normally a fan of spaghetti squash but I will definitely be making this again. Spicy, peanutty, tender, and delicious.
I skipped the 'fishy' sauces and used Worcester instead - FANTASTIC!!!!!!!
Rave reviews from my hubby and me! Outstanding taste and textures.
add some pepper flake for some bite and cooked the chicken in some chili garlic sauce! Yum Yum!
Pretty good and relatively easy. You could probably use a premade peanut sauce to save time.

This was great. However, I agree that it needs some sweetening. I added a couple of squirts of agave syrup & topped with chopped cilantro & peanuts. Even my daughter who hates spagetti squash liked it!

My 16 year old daughter even liked it! I'm allergic to shellfish so I eliminated the oyster sauce and it was still really good. Only change I made is that I added the veggie mixture to the chicken and sauce instead of vice versa. I felt like there was more veggie's for the amount of sauce (could have been due to the size of the spaghetti squash) I did this to make sure there was enough sauce. I ended up using about 3/4 of the veggies. I also sprinkled chopped peanuts on top.
So delicious

SO we were gonna make it with spaghetti squash but when I went to get my squash- it was rotten. Already had everything else prepped, so I did it with Shirataki noodles instead.Used a bunch of random frozen veggies and shrimp instead of veggies. LOVED the sauce. We were out of rice vinegar and used apple cider vinegar instead. Excited to use variable ingredients but keep the base recipe

This recipe is awesome! I omitted the oyster sauce, just because I didn't have any. But other than that, I followed the recipe exactly. The only change I will make in the future is the method of cooking the squash. I prefer to cook it cut side down in a 9x13 with a little water in the bottom--it cuts down on the burning on the loose strands. It definitely made more than 4 servings for us and was very filling. Will be making again!

First recipe that I have ever reviewed on this site. This was absolutely delicious. I will probably add another 1/2 tsp of the chile-garlic sauce next time to kick it up just a bit, but otherwise, I wouldn't change a thing. It is definitely going into my rotation.
I had leftover spaghetti squash to use up...and this was awesome! No leftovers! Went well with flatbread crackers. Naan would be great too!
Great the first day, but by the next day the flavor had blended so well, it was even delicious cold.
Great flavor, easy to make and I will make it again! It is super nutritious! Thanks, allrecipes community!
Used tofu instead of chicken. Even the leftovers were good. My husband loved it so I plan to make it again.
